text:
{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM>2. Bey Herrn Euler dem Buchbinder am Rheinsprung ist zu erfragen, wo folgende Bücher irraisonablem Preise zu haben seyen: <BIBL><TITLE>Janii & Tremellii Biblia cum Annotationibus</TITLE></BIBL>; <BIBL><TITLE>Acta Eruditorum Lipsiensia</TITLE><NOTE>de An.</NOTE><YEAR>1738</YEAR> & <YEAR>1739</YEAR></BIBL>; <BIBL><AUTHOR>Mohemii</AUTHOR><TITLE>Institutiones histor. Christ.</TITLE><NOTE>maiores</NOTE><VOLUME>1. Seculi</VOLUME><FORMAT>samtl. in 4to</FORMAT></BIBL>; <BIBL><TITLE>Titus Livius</TITLE><AUTHOR>Joannis Clerici</AUTHOR></BIBL>; <BIBL><AUTHOR>Ovidii</AUTHOR><TITLE>Tristia & Epistolae ex Ponto</TITLE><NOTE>mit Sinceri Anmerckungen</NOTE></BIBL>; <BIBL><AUTHOR>Herodianus</AUTHOR><NOTE>Graece & Latine cum notis Bocceri</NOTE></BIBL>; <BIBL><AUTHOR>Elianus</AUTHOR><NOTE>Graece & Latine cum notis Schefferi</NOTE></BIBL>; <BIBL><AUTHOR>Schrevelii</AUTHOR><TITLE>Lexicon Graeco-Latinum & Lat. Graec.</TITLE></BIBL>; <BIBL><AUTHOR>Nisselii</AUTHOR><TITLE>Biblia Hebraea</TITLE></BIBL>; und <BIBL><AUTHOR>Buxtorfii</AUTHOR><TITLE>Lexicon</TITLE><FORMAT>samtl. in 8vo</FORMAT></BIBL></ITEM>","number_of_corrections":18,"explanation":"I made the XML well-formed and normalized the bibliographic entries. Main changes:
1) Replaced several corrupted/garbled character sequences with intended text (e.g. 'Bacher' -> 'Bücher'; corrupted format tokens -> '4to', '8vo'; 'Prei...' -> 'Preise').
2) Escaped all literal ampersands as & so the XML is valid (in titles and phrases such as 'Janii & Tremellii', 'Tristia & Epistolae', 'Graeco & Latine', and the year conjunction).
3) Fixed improper nesting: closed the Mohemii <BIBL> entry before starting the next <BIBL> (Titus Livius), so there are no nested/overlapping <BIBL> tags.
4) Introduced <NOTE> elements for short inline descriptors (e.g. 'de An.', 'maiores', 'mit Sinceri Anmerckungen', the 'Graece & Latine cum notis ...' phrases) to keep structure clear.
5) Standardized and normalized format indications to readable bibliographic forms ('samtl. in 4to', 'samtl. in 8vo').
6) Ensured every opened tag is properly closed and that the complete string is a single well-formed XML <ITEM> element.
If you want the XML split into multiple lines/indented for readability or adjusted tag names (e.g. separate <BIBL> container element for all entries), I can reformat accordingly."}

Graec.</TITLE></BIBL>; <BIBL><AUTHOR>Nisselii</AUTHOR><TITLE>Biblia Hebraea</TITLE></BIBL>; und <BIBL><AUTHOR>Buxtorfii</AUTHOR><TITLE>Lexicon</TITLE><FORMAT>samtl. in 8vo</FORMAT></BIBL></ITEM>
parsed.explanation:
I made the XML well-formed and normalized the bibliographic entries. Main changes:
1) Replaced several corrupted/garbled character sequences with intended text (e.g. 'Bacher' -> 'Bücher'; corrupted format tokens -> '4to', '8vo'; 'Prei...' -> 'Preise').
2) Escaped all literal ampersands as & so the XML is valid (in titles and phrases such as 'Janii & Tremellii', 'Tristia & Epistolae', 'Graeco & Latine', and the year conjunction).
3) Fixed improper nesting: closed the Mohemii <BIBL> entry before starting the next <BIBL> (Titus Livius), so there are no nested/overlapping <BIBL> tags.
4) Introduced <NOTE> elements for short inline descriptors (e.g. 'de An.', 'maiores', 'mit Sinceri Anmerckungen', the 'Graece & Latine cum notis ...' phrases) to keep structure clear.
5) Standardized and normalized format indications to readable bibliographic forms ('samtl. in 4to', 'samtl. in 8vo').
6) Ensured every opened tag is properly closed and that the complete string is a single well-formed XML <ITEM> element.
If you want the XML split into multiple lines/indented for readability or adjusted tag names (e.g. separate <BIBL> container element for all entries), I can reformat accordingly.
